results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(m,n) = number of m-ary words of length n with cyclically adjacent elements differing by 2 or less.
comment: All rows are linear recurrences with constant coefficients. See PARI script to obtain generating functions.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1277
mathematica: TransferGf[m_, u_, t_, v_, z_] := Array[u, m].LinearSolve[IdentityMatrix[m] - z*Array[t, {m, m}], Array[v, m]]
RowGf[d_, m_, z_] := 1 + z*Sum[TransferGf[m, Boole[# == k] &, Boole[Abs[#1 - #2] <= d] &, Boole[Abs[# - k] <= d] &, z], {k, 1, m}];
row[m_] := row[m] = CoefficientList[RowGf[diff, m, x] + O[x]^mmax, x];
Table[T[m - n, n], {m, m0, mmax}, {n, m - m0, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 16 2017, adapted from PARI *)
program: for(m=3, 10, v=Vec(RowGf(2,m,x) + O(x^8)); for(n=1, length(v), print1( v[n], ", ") ); print(); );
